intro: Limonium costae, commonly known as sea helene, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and saline soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Limonium costae has narrow, linear leaves and produces clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in summer. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its drought tolerance and aesthetic appeal.
